comment: Dr. Iscimen (formally Ersoz) is a wonderful professor. She's been very helpful, answers any questions with care. Goes over quizzes & tests after they've been graded. She cares about the students. We have 2 tests, then a final (3 in total), quizzes throughout the semester, graded assignments, and homework (not graded). I plan to take her again.
She is very strict, she always gives homework and her gradeness sucks! She is very monoton and boring. I am gonna fall asleep. She doesn't have any pinch of humor.

The negative comments on here are the most misleading comments I have EVER heard about a professor, seriously. SHE IS THE BEST! She helps you understand & love math, and feel so prepared & confident to be a teacher!

This is THE BEST professor at KSU! As a person who does not like math - I now LOVE it because of her! - she made me do a complete 180! I feel completely prepared & confident to become an elementary teacher - she provides AMAZING insight & is beyond helpful. Take her for any class she offers. Don't listen to any negative comments.

Dr. Ersoz has completely restored my confidance in my math abilities. I wish she were not leaving KSU. I would have taken all my math courses with her. She was so nice and very understanding. She never makes you feel stupid, even if you get the wrong answers in class discussions!

She is so sweet! These are the most misleading comments about any professor at KSU! The class is somewhat boring as it teaches stuff you already know, but she is helpfull and as long as you show your work, she doesn't grade hard and it's an easy A.

SO, dont consider comments with spelling and grammatical errors. That should tell you something about the person writing the comment. She is not exciting, however, she knows her stuff. She is a great teacher, she KNOWS hows to teach. Her goal is to make you understand what kids might be going through mathematically. I would take her again.

First off, if a professor cannot speak clear English, they should not be teaching.  She makes pretty easy concepts impossible to learn because she expects you to think exactly like a child, which is impossible to do because we are college students. You definitely need the textbook. Do not take this teacher!!!

When I'm in class, I get the vibe that she's not just a professor that doesn't understand her students, she's human and understands how tough it can be for students. This is my best class and I think she does a great job. Everyone learns differently and I think she does take time to try and help her struggling students understand the material bette
makes learning math very boring because she is boring and too serious and technical. If some humor were put in to class it may make a differenc. Don't go there if your serious about your education.

She is one of the worst teachers I have ever had!! I dreaded coming to each class session. She is a very monotone and boring teacher and you will want to fall asleep. She can be hard to understand at times and does not explain things well. She grades very harshly. She re-taught everything I already knew instead of actually teaching us how to teach.

I was worried after reading these comments, but this class was NOTHING like that. A lot of individuals make the class harder than it has to be. She likes detailed answers and explanations- if you can do that, you can make an A! Just always write everything- more than you assume you would need!

You will teach yourself the entire class. All you do is discuss problems in a group and then discuss as a class. If you don't answer exactly as she wants you will get points off, even for homework. Take someone else if you can!

Do you like fractions? I sure hope so, because that's all you're going to be doing in this class. I felt like she graded way too harsh and technical. She is a sweet and helpful lady but just be prepared to have points deducted for really technical stuff if it's not up to her standards. Quite frustrating.

I was worried based on others' comments, but she's really not that bad. This class, not just her style, is definitely a different way of thinking about math (prove it - why,why,why) but she's very willing to help if you ask for it and she cares about her students.  Yes, she grades hard and sometimes questions are worth a lot of points.

This is by far the worst professor I have ever had. Her grading is ridiculous, she can't explain anything, its just BAD. I know people read these and think "oh how bad could it really be?" TRUST ME... stay away!!!

HORRIBLE Instructor!!! At all cost, stay away from her classes!  She does take attendance and if you are late, even on your 1st day...she will deduct points!  All semester long we discussed fractions!  I don't think I know how to do them anymore after this class!  Everything is, Why, Why, Why...Why does that make since to do that? STAY AWAY!!!
